title: Weight loss news: Weight Watchers couple drop TEN STONE to have a baby
text:
Dawn French has dramatically slimmed down in recent years PA REAL LIFE Weight Watchers: Becky and Andy met at a meeting, but then their bad eating habits started again 
But when Becky and Andy moved in together in July 2013, they slipped back into their old ways, going to the pub and getting takeaways every other night 
By the time they got married in October 2014, their size was becoming more of an issue. 
“I couldn’t get the Alfed Angelo prices gown I wanted to get married in, because they only came in slimmer sizes,” Becky, who then weighed 16 stone and wore a size 22, said. 
Andy who weighed 18-and-a-half stone and wore a XXL when they tied the know, said the only place he could find a suit big enough was Asda and that he couldn’t even fasten the jacket. 
But it wasn’t until the couple realised that their weight was stopping them from having a baby, that they decided something needed to change. PA REAL LIFE Weight Watchers: The couple finally put the effort in to lose weight to have a baby 
Together, they returned to the place where they had fallen in love - their local Weight Watchers group. 
Finally committed to slimming, the couple transformed their diet - restricting themselves to one takeaway a week and eating chicken pastas, curries and spaghetti Bolognese made from scratch, with plenty of fruit and vegetables. 
By September 2016, Becky had lost four-and-a-half stone. She was down to 11 stone 6lbs and a size 12, while Andy had lost five stone 2lbs, weighed 12 stone 7lbs and wore a size medium. 
Although the couple made an appointment for IVF treatment, in mid September, Becky’s period was a week late, and they received the news they had been dreaming of. 
Becky said: “We were in such disbelief I did five pregnancy tests and went tot he dot’s for another. I don’t think it sunk in until our 12 week scan and then in January we found out we were having a boy. We can’t wait, and all our family are so excited.”
